text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Tunis | native_name = تونس | native_name_lang = aeb | other_name = | type = Governorate | image_skyline = | image_alt = | image_caption = | image_shield = | shield_alt = | image_map = Tunis in Tunisia.svg | map_alt = | map_caption = Map of Tunisia with Tunis highlighted | coordinates = | coor_pinpoint = | coordinates_footnotes = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = Tunisia | established_title = Created | established_date = June 1956 | seat_type = Capital | seat = Tunis | government_footnotes = | leader_party = DCR | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = Mondher Friji | unit_pref = Metric | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 346 | area_rank = Ranked 24th of 24 | area_note = | elevation_footnotes = | elevation_m = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 1,056,247 | population_as_of = 2014 | population_rank = Ranked 1st of 24 | population_density_km2 = auto | population_demonym = Tunisois () | population_note = | timezone1 = CET | utc_offset1 = +01 | postal_code_type = Postal prefix | postal_code = 10xx | area_code_type = Calling code | area_code = 71 | iso_code = TN-11 | website = | footnotes = }} Tunis Governorate ( ) is one of the twenty-four governorates of Tunisia. It is in the northeastern part of the country. It covers an area of 346 km². As of the 2014 census, 1,056,247 people lived there. Census 2014 (National Institute of Statistics) The capital is Tunis, which is also the national capital. It is the smallest governorate of the country by area and is also the most populated governorate of the country. == References == Category:1956 establishments in Tunisia Category:Governorates of Tunisia
title: Tunis Governorate
